titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Gaylesta Brochures on Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Mental Health Collection
Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library Gaylesta publications collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Christy Tomecek

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 11:15

did.unittitle: Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library Gaylesta publications collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of ephemera, mostly educational brochures, about issues and experiences members of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) community may face that can impact their mental health. Topics include HIV/AIDS, gender identity, biphobia and bisexual erasure, body image and eating disorders, coming out, queer parenting, domestic violence, stress and anxiety, and trauma. There are also brochures covering kink-aware therapy for those who are interested in BDSM (bondage, discipline, sadism, masochism) and/or fetish practices, and polyamory-aware therapy for those interested or involved in ethical non-monogamous relationship structures. Finally, there is an information card about Gaylesta's services and mission and a brochure for therapists interested in joining Gaylesta. All materials also give contact information for Gaylesta's referral services.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by document type.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Gaylesta was founded in 1987 as a psychotherapy association for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) community in San Francisco, California. It was formally established as an unincorporated association in 1988 and incorporated as a non-profit organization in 1997. Gaylesta's main services include referring prospective patients to member therapists via a phone number or their website, organized by specialty of the therapist and patient needs, outreach to the LGBTQ community at public events, educational and professional development workshops, and mentoring.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Librarian for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender Studies and Women's, Gender, and Sexuality Studies, 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library Gaylesta Publications Collection (MS 2024). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of ephemera, mostly educational brochures, about issues and experiences members of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) community may face that can impact their mental health. Topics include HIV/AIDS, gender identity, biphobia and bisexual erasure, body image and eating disorders, coming out, queer parenting, domestic violence, stress and anxiety, and trauma. There are also brochures covering kink-aware therapy for those who are interested in BDSM (bondage, discipline, sadism, masochism) and/or fetish practices, and polyamory-aware therapy for those interested or involved in ethical non-monogamous relationship structures. Finally, there is an information card about Gaylesta's services and mission and a brochure for therapists interested in joining Gaylesta. All materials also give contact information for Gaylesta's referral services.
